sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| We investigated the effects of aggressive antihyperten-sive therapy based on hydrochlorothiazide, candesartan or lisinopril on urinary albumin excretion, endothelial function and inflammatory activity in hypertensive type II diabetic individuals.
content: effects of aggressive antihyperten-sive therapy based on hydrochlorothiazide, candesartan or lisinopril on urinary albumin excretion, endothelial function and inflammatory activity in hypertensive type II diabetic individuals
label: pr.SS

sentence: 25 ||| Introduction ||| 1.14 ||| The goal of the study was to investigate the effects of aggressive antihypertensive treatment based on hydrochlorothiazide, candesartan or lisinopril on left ventricular mass and arterial stiffness (as primary outcomes), and on other cardiovascular risk factors (as secondary outcomes).
content: to investigate the effects of aggressive antihypertensive treatment based on hydrochlorothiazide, candesartan or lisinopril on left ventricular mass and arterial stiffness (as primary outcomes), and on other cardiovascular risk factors
label: pr.SS

sentence: 26 ||| Introduction ||| 1.15 ||| This study describes the effects on the secondary end points, urinary albumin excretion, endothelial function and inflammatory activity.
content: urinary albumin excretion, endothelial function and inflammatory activity
label: pr.SS

sentence: 29 ||| Subjects ||| 2.3 ||| Inclusion criteria for the run-in period were type II diabetes mellitus for X6 months (WHO criteria 1985), age between 35 and 70 years, Caucasian ethnicity, and urinary albumin excretion o 100 mg/24 h. Individuals were excluded in case of pregnancy or planning pregnancy, a history of myocardial infarction, angina pectoris, coronary artery bypass surgery, angioplasty, stroke, congestive heart failure, malignancy or other serious illnesses, serum creatinine 4140 mmol/l, body mass index 435 kg/m 2 , alcohol and/or drug abuse, or participation in other clinical trials.
content: type II diabetes mellitus for X6 months
label: po.SS

sentence: 99 ||| Results ||| 4.33 ||| Our results suggest that, among relatively uncomplicated hypertensive type II diabetic patients with normoalbuminuria or early microalbuminuria, aggressive antihypertensive treatment decreases urinary albumin excretion, improves some aspects of endothelial function, and decreases inflammatory activity.
content: aggressive antihypertensive treatment decreases urinary albumin excretion, improves some aspects of endothelial function, and decreases inflammatory activity
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 108 ||| Results ||| 4.42 ||| Indeed, experimental work has shown that the activity of the transcription factor NF-kB, which regulates gene expression of several endothelial cell adhesion molecules, including sVCAM-1 and sI-CAM-1, can be decreased both by decreasing blood pressure and by blocking the effects of angiotensin II.
content: the activity of the transcription factor NF-kB, which regulates gene expression of several endothelial cell adhesion molecules, including sVCAM-1 and sI-CAM-1, can be decreased both by decreasing blood pressure and by blocking the effects of angiotensin II
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 124 ||| Results ||| 4.58 ||| In conclusion, aggressive antihypertensive treatment based on hydrochlorothiazide, candesartan or lisinopril, although difficult, can improve kidney and endothelial function, and inflammatory activity in relatively uncomplicated hypertensive type II diabetic individuals.
content: improve kidney and endothelial function, and inflammatory activity in relatively uncomplicated hypertensive type II diabetic individuals
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 118 ||| Results ||| 4.52 ||| Most importantly, the groups were small, and we may have missed differences between the hydrochlorothiazide-, candesartan-and lisinopril-based treatments, as illustrated by the confidence limits of the results shown in Table 4.
